gameData

Class GameStat

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameData.GameStat

  • public class GameStat
extends java.lang.Object
    General summary stats of where the game is at the current point, primary score and inning. In the future is liable to include other important information like innings charged to a current pitcher. An empty GameStat should represent the typical conditions of a baseball game at the top of the 1st inning before a batter has come to the plate.
    Author:
    Matthew Bunge

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameStat()
      Creates a GameStat representing a brand new game instance.

      • getOuts

        public int getOuts()
        Returns the number of outs in the current frame.
        Returns:
        the number of outs in the current frame.

      • yerOut

        public void yerOut()
        Increments the number of outs. Will not increment past 3.

      • update

        public void update()
        Flips over the inning if a third out has been recorded.

      • score

        public void score()
        Increments runs of the current team batting.

      • hit

        public void hit()
        Increments the hits of the team currently up to bat.

      • inningEnd

        public boolean inningEnd()
        Indicates whether it's time to turn over the ending. Turns over the inning internally if it is time.
        Returns:
        true if the inning is over, false otherwise.

      • getHomeSpread

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getHomeSpread()
        Returns the inning by inning list of the runs scored by the home team. If a frame has not been reaching the spread will have no value for it.
        Returns:
        the list of runs scored by inning by the home team.

      • getAwaySpread

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getAwaySpread()
        Returns the inning by inning list of the runs scored by the away team. If a frame has not been reached the spread will have no value for it.
        Returns:
        the list of runs scored by inning by the away team.

      • getHomeRuns

        public int getHomeRuns()
        Gets the total number of runs scored by the home team.
        Returns:
        the runs scored by the home team.

        public int getAwayRuns()
        Gets the total number of runs scored by the away team.
        Returns:
        the runs scored by the away team.

      • getHomeHits

      • getInning

        public int getInning()
        Returns the inning of the current game. For example, top of the first or bottom of the first will return a 1.
        Returns:
        the number of the current inning.
